comment: Professor Adkisson is very lighthearted, cracks jokes and the lectures aren't boring. Quizzes are free points, but the tests and project determine your fate. Make sure you study a lot, but he does a good job of ensuring you know what to expect on the exams if you show up. He's the most down to earth professor I've taken. Amazing professor. TAKE HIM
Lectures are pretty boring, class was easy at first. But at some points it felt like his lectures were all over the place. He is very repetitive at times, time moves so slowly during his lectures.
Amazing teacher this is a sign to take him.

Jeff was a wonderful professor. He was very helpful, great at communicating, and deeply knowledgeable.

He has three decades of experience in the software engineering field and co-owns a successful company, so he truly understands the field in which he teaches. Last but not least, Jeff is also just an honest, genuine person with an amicable nature.

Professor Jeff is an awesome educator. He is actually an industry professional who knows his stuff, which is rare to come by these days in academia. You will learn a lot from the semester project and will leave this course with tremendous growth in SWE / CS if you put forth the effort. The exams and quizzes are easy, please take this professor!

Jeff is so caring and a great teacher. His class is not a easy A but it is not a hard class. If you go to the lectures and pay attention you will pass. Half of the grade is a group project and I think having a good team is essential for that. I would take Jeff 1000 times he is definitely top tier for CS teachers at kennesaw.

Quizzes are decent and you can earn partial credit on Tests. Grading is pretty fair. Tests focus a lot on the textbook and its a pretty good amount of reading. There is a big group project worth 50% of your final grade. You have to teach yourself how to use the programs and tools required to complete the project. Lectures are pretty boring.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: He was unfair. He had favorites. I know a lot of people who like him. But personally, I deserved an A.

You're doing yourself a disservice if you don't take a class with him. He only teaches because he enjoys it, he wants you to learn and have a fruitful career. The course can be a lot but he makes sure you understand the content and enjoy it. He lets the class make their own groups for the project, and his tests aren't very hard.

Jeff is a great instructor! As an industry worker, he's a really perfect fit for SWE 3313. He really cares about how you do and gives you all the resources you need for your project. I struggle with sustaining attention, but he's very easy for me to listen to. Great guy overall.

This course covers a lot of content, but Jeff does a great job at breaking it down. He is very accessible outside of class and brings in his experience in the field to the classroom. If you see his name, take his class.

One of the best professors I've ever had. He's got years of experience in software engineering and shares his experiences during lectures, which makes them genuinely interesting. He also gives the extremely thorough feedback on exams and projects, highlighting what you did well and explaining how to do better on what you did wrong. Fantastic dude.
This the best class I took so far, I would definitely retake him again
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Adkisson is very available, approachable, and a fair grader. The class I took (SWE 3313) consisted of a lengthy group project, but he broke separate parts of the project into multiple deadlines to ensure everyone was on the same page. Getting in contact with him for any questions is very easy via email, which was a godsend.

Fantastic. Take him if you want to really learn, have a great time, and finish with a solid idea of what SWE careers are like. Excellent feedback, lenient grading, focused on ensuring students learn something. Lectures are fun, engaging, and detailed. 2 tests, optional final, semester long group project. Won't hand an A but will help you make one.
